intro: Astragalus bifidus, commonly known as the split pea vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often found in grasslands and rocky habitats. The plant features slender stems and small,蝶形 (butterfly-shaped) flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. Its pods contain small, edible seeds that have been used in traditional cuisines. Astragalus bifidus is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility.
